autonomy.question: Did I take for granted my accomplishments, attributing them to personal abilities rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others' successes or accomplishments would hinder their progress, so I wouldn't feel inferior by comparison?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use my words to disrespect others in conversation?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that demeaned, belittled, or spoke disrespectfully to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to trying new recipes that may have led me to consume more than necessary
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to trying new recipes that may have led me to consume more than necessary?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, perhaps when sharing meals with others?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, thereby showing an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I used my words to share private affairs about others, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in spreading information about my acquaintances ' personal lives
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in spreading information about my acquaintances' personal lives, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: from time that could have been dedicated to rest and worship
impiety.question: Did I engage in unnecessary work on a Sunday, potentially taking away from time that could have been dedicated to rest and worship?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: towards my friends , family members , or acquaintances
anger.question: Have I nursed anger towards my friends, family members, or acquaintances rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

extracted_data_phrases: against my friends , family members , or acquaintances
anger.question: Have I nursed anger against my friends, family members, or acquaintances rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger in my heart, allowing it to simmer unresolved, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
